meanings.definition: The structure forming the upper covering of a building or vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The roof of the house kept us dry during the rain.
meanings.sent2: The cat sat on the roof of the shed, enjoying the view.
meanings.sent3: The roof of the car seemed to be waving at us as we drove by.
meanings.sent4: Under the roof of the sky, we felt small and insignificant.
meanings.sent5: The roof of the barn creaked in the wind, creating a haunting melody.

meanings.definition: The top inner surface of a covered area or space.
meanings.sent1: The tent's roof was a comforting sight in the dark forest.
meanings.sent2: The roof of the cave was covered in ancient drawings.
meanings.sent3: The roof of the blanket fort collapsed with giggles and laughter.
meanings.sent4: Under the roof of the umbrella, we found shelter from the storm.
meanings.sent5: The roof of the doghouse provided shade for the tired pup.

meanings.sent1: We need to roof the new gazebo before the party.
meanings.sent2: The workers will roof the house with red tiles.
meanings.sent3: I tried to roof the sandcastle with seashells, but they kept falling off.
meanings.sent4: She wanted to roof her treehouse with colorful fabric for a whimsical touch.
meanings.sent5: The villagers came together to roof the community center in record time.
